page.title: 02THOMAS MOOREHOUSES BREWERY
page.content: Thomas Moorhouse founded the brewery in 1880's. It is a small, independent brewe with only four employees. Their work includes brewing the beer, taking i materials, filling the barrels and cleng the equipment. They work from nine o'clock in the morning until five oclock in the afternoon. Each barrel costs 102 pounds and Moorhouses make, on average, 60 barrels each week. Techniques for making the beer have not altered since the brewery first started making it. In making beer, the men use malt, hops, sugar, yeast and water. Moorhouses advertise ,mainly in loca n
